block_comment: This block of code is essentially responsible for reading data from memory. Its function is to retrieve data from a specific memory location, defined by the `rd_ptr_timing` variable. The implementation leverages the 'assign' statement, which in verilog represents a concurrent assignment that continually assesses the right-hand side expression (here `mem[rd_ptr_timing]`) and assigns it to the left-hand side variable (`mem_out`). This assignment is instantaneous and continuous, thus the variable `mem_out` represents the value stored at the memory location determined by the `rd_ptr_timing` index.
